intro: Lippia foncki, commonly known as Mexican blueweed, is a flowering plant native to Central America and parts of the southern United States. It belongs to the Verbenaceae family and is characterized by its aromatic, silver-gray foliage and small blue or violet flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, sunny habitats such as grasslands and rocky soils. It is often used in traditional medicine for its purported anti-inflammatory and antimicrobial properties. Lippia foncki is also valued in horticulture for its ornamental appeal and ability to attract pollinators.
